title: India vs Australia, 3rd Test Day 4 Highlights: IND 252/9 vs AUS at stumps in Brisbane - The Indian Express
summary:
India vs Australia, 3rd Test Day 4 Highlights: IND 252/9 vs AUS at stumps in Brisbane

Date: Tuesday, Publication: Indian Express

After Day 4 of the third Test at Gabba, India scored 252/9, avoiding follow-on against Australia. KL Rahul and Ravindra Jadeja made significant contributions to keep the match competitive.

  • India trails by 193 runs but has crossed the 246 run mark, preventing Australia from enforcing a follow-on.
  • Josh Hazlewood is out of the Test due to injury.
  • The series stands at 1-1 after India won the first Test and Australia claimed victory in Adelaide.
“Raining Indian wickets at Gabba” - A difficult day for Indian batters.

The match remains open for a draw as India seeks to recover in the ongoing series.
newTitle: India vs Australia, 3rd Test Day 4 Highlights: IND 252/9 vs AUS at stumps in Brisbane

The third Test match between India and Australia at the Gabba is under threat from rain, with a high chance of showers expected on the final day of the match. India has put up a strong fight, but the weather may impact their chances of making a comeback.

title: Shaw left out of Mumbai squad for start of Vijay Hazare Trophy - Cricbuzz
summary:
Prithvi Shaw Left Out of Mumbai Squad for Vijay Hazare Trophy

Date: Tue, Dec 17, 2024

Source: Cricbuzz

Prithvi Shaw has been omitted from the Mumbai squad announced for the first three matches of the Vijay Hazare Trophy, drawing attention due to his impressive performance record.

  • Shaw boasts an average of 55.72 from 65 List A matches and was integral to Mumbai's recent Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy victory.
  • His exclusion sparked an emotional response on social media, expressing his determination to return.
  • Captain Shreyas Iyer praised Shaw's talent but emphasized the need for improvement in work ethics.
  • The selectors have opted for 17-year-old Ayush Mhatre and other players for the opening spot.
  • Notable omissions from the squad include Rahane, Mohit Awasthi due to injury, and Shams Mulani.
"Tell me god, what more do I have to see... if 65 innings, 3399 runs at an average of 55.7 with a strike rate of 126, I'm not good enough..." - Prithvi Shaw

The Mumbai squad aims to kick off the Vijay Hazare Trophy without some experienced players, focusing on youth and potential.

title: Google Responds After Jasprit Bumrah Mentions Tech Giant To Shut Down Tricky Question In Australia - NDTV Sports

title: Sunil Gavaskar Fumes At Mohammed Siraj's 'Risky' Act, Questions His 'Cricketing Awareness' - NDTV Sports
summary:

Date: December 17, 2024 Source: NDTV

Legendary Indian cricket team skipper Sunil Gavaskar expressed his frustration towards Mohammed Siraj after a mix-up during a critical moment in the third Test against Australia.

  • Siraj walked in at No. 9 with India needing runs to avoid follow-on.
  • A mix-up occurred when Siraj took a risky single, prompting concern from Gavaskar.
  • Gavaskar questioned Siraj's cricketing awareness during such an important phase of the game.
  • India managed to avoid follow-on thanks to a solid 10th-wicket partnership between Jasprit Bumrah and Akash Deep.
  • The match is currently tied in the five-match series at 1-1.
"Look at that. There's got to be some cricketing awareness. You are a no.9 batter. You cannot think of taking risky singles," said Gavaskar.

This incident highlights the pressure of Test cricket and the need for strategic thinking in crucial moments.

summary:
Virat Kohli’s bat works wonders for Akash Deep as India avert follow-on in Brisbane Test

Publication Date: Recent Publication - Source: Times of India

On day four of the Brisbane Test, India successfully avoided the follow-on, thanks to a determined last-wicket stand between Akash Deep and Jasprit Bumrah. This partnership significantly hampered Australia's chances of winning, especially after Josh Hazlewood's injury.

  • Akash Deep played aggressively to alleviate pressure during the final stages of the innings.
  • His edged boundary and a six off Cummins led to celebrations in the Indian camp.
  • At stumps, Deep was unbeaten on 27, with Bumrah on 10, forming a crucial 39-run partnership.
  • This performance has reduced India's chances of defeat, with Australia needing to take ten wickets.
  • Hazlewood's injury adds to Australia’s challenges in this Test match.
  • Deep received a heartfelt gift from Virat Kohli, who surprised him with a bat before the Test.
“Bat chaiye kya tujhe?” (Do you need a bat?) - Virat Kohli
“I will never play with that bat. It’s a huge gift from Virat bhaiya, and I will keep it as a souvenir.” - Akash Deep

This partnership of Akash Deep and Bumrah has greatly bolstered India's position in the match, making Australia's task of winning significantly harder.
newTitle: Virat Kohli’s bat works wonders for Akash Deep as India avert follow-on in Brisbane Test

title: 'Shubman Gill ko runs ki bilkul bhookh nahi hai' - The Times of India
summary:
Shubman Gill's Lack of Hunger for Runs Criticized by Basit Ali

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

Former Pakistan batter Basit Ali criticized Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal for their dismissals in the first innings of the ongoing Brisbane Test. He highlighted their need for greater hunger for runs and advised them to learn from legends like Sunil Gavaskar.

  • Ali noted that Jaiswal and Gill's early dismissals reflect their lack of seriousness.
  • Gavaskar concurred, emphasizing the importance of shot selection in Test cricket.
  • Gill has played 30 Tests, averaging 36.45, while Jaiswal has made an impressive start with an average of 54.89 over 16 matches.
  • India is currently struggling in the Test, trailing Australia significantly.
“Gill ko toh bilkul hi nahi hai bhookh (Gill is not hungry at all for runs),” said Basit.

In conclusion, both players are encouraged to improve their performances by seeking guidance from experienced cricketers.
newTitle: Shubman Gill's Lack of Hunger for Runs Criticized by Basit Ali
